intro: Belandra, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Belandra typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique botanical appearance.
